data.job_description:
The Growth Alliance enables HelloFresh to expand by getting more customers to try, recommend, and return back to our products. We build digital customer facing products that are used by customers all over the world. Our teams work at a global scale on services like scalable web mono repo infrastructure, checkout funnel on web and native apps, discounting and wallet services, price experimentation infrastructure, and referral marketing technology.

In the virality tribe we are on a mission to enable and encourage customers to recommend and share meal experiences with their friends, earning rewards in return.

The role

As a Senior Product Owner in our Virality tribe, you’ll join a cross-functional team that is building Web and App customer-facing products for customers across 18 geographies. You will discover, identify and launch features and processes that help HelloFresh attract new customers to try our service. You will impact the business growth by improving our refer-a-friend program and identify new opportunities for our tribe.

What you’ll do
• Collaborate with a cross-functional team of Engineers, Product Designers, Researchers, Product Analysts, Campaign Managers and business stakeholders to establish and execute our long-term product strategy
• Deeply understand our users, what gets them to buy a HelloFresh mealkit and channel it into a multiple quarter roadmap
• Discover new product opportunities to help our customers share invites with their network
• Run experiments and collect customers feedback to improve the user experience from sending an invite to receiving their reward
• Define, Plan and Deliver complex features and track their impact
• Set-up adequate processes to work with your agile team and constantly improve them

What you’ll bring
• You have solid experience in building customer-facing products at scale, preferably at an e-commerce company
• Ability to drive product discovery and define the “problem space” and write product requirements for complex domains
• You feel comfortable using both qualitative and quantitative data to validate hypotheses and drive decisions
• You have experience in performing analysis with large datasets, have a good understanding of statistical analysis, experiment design, and common pitfalls of data analysis
• You are a skilled communicator: can distill complex ideas to make them universally understandable, have attention to detail and be willing to explain to others

What we offer
• Comprehensive relocation assistance to move to Berlin plus visa application support
• Healthy discount on weekly HelloFresh boxes
• Annual learning and development budget to attend conferences or purchase educational resources plus access to the HelloFresh Academy
• A diverse and vibrant international environment of 70+ different nationalities
• Additional perks include: Free crash course in German, compensation for advanced external German classes, discounts for our neighboring gym & Urban Sports Club, summer & winter parties, discount on our HelloFresh GO vending machines
• The chance to have a significant impact on one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Europe in an exciting growth phase

#Product #Growth

Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

For insight into our interview process take a look at our recent post here.

data.job_description:
PLEASE APPLY DIRECTLY AT: https://grnh.se/6b68aec61us

Please mention Angellist as the source. Thanks in advance.

We are expanding and looking for a Technical Product Owner (m/f/d) as soon as possible for our Payments, Connectivity and Reconciliation team in a full-time capacity to energetically support product management. The cross-functional team develops and maintains the core payment engine and API, adapters to work with downstream parties (payment providers) and reconciliation.

THE POSITION

Coming from a technical / software engineering background you are able to communicate with our stakeholders, developers, and designers on eyes' level. This Technical Product Owner role involves in-depth specification of new products and improvement of existing products. You will manage prioritizations and expectations of stakeholders regarding the delivery of multiple strategic business initiatives and product requests while acting in full transparency with both the stakeholders and your team. You will ensure high quality and stability of new features.

REQUIRED SKILLS
• At least 5 years of experience as a technical product owner, developer, or a similar role.
• Solid knowledge of web technologies such as REST APIs and JSON.
• Proven ability to conduct compelling research and analysis for potential new functionalities.
• Demonstrated ability to figure out solutions to hard problems with many constraints, using sound judgement to assess risks, and to lay out your argument in a well-structured, data-informed, written narrative.
• Strong communication skills to align stakeholders and team members. Demonstrated ability to work with Designers and Developers in a constructive and collaborative relationship.
• Fluent English language skills.
• A hands-on startup and team player attitude.
• Proven leading skills, including working with remote team members.
• Experience with agile development processes and working in cross-functional teams.

DESIRED SKILLS
• Experience in the online payments industry.
• Hands-on experience with programming for webservice APIs.
• Experience in running product discoveries and product delivery.
• Computer science or related degree.
• Experience in system integration projects.

WHAT WE OFFER
• A dynamic and spirited team that knows how to have fun.
• High potential for personal development.
• The ability to have an impact and shape the future of Merchant Services at Payoneer.
• A working environment built around people.
• The possibility to do remote work in accordance with company policies.
• Other benefits from free beverages and monthly team breakfasts to a flexible working style and a spacious, naturally lit office space.

Payoneer Germany focuses on Information Technology, E-Commerce, Business Services, and Finance Technology. Their company has offices in Munich. They have a mid-size team that's between 51-200 employees.

You can view their website at https://www.payoneer.com

Job Description Summary
In your role as Product Owner for Data Analytics (m/w/d) you drive the specification, development and productization of an analytical platform to store, analyze and visualize data of ultrasound examinations to generate and provide essential business and medical information. In close collaboration with internal and external stakeholders you create and maintain the product backlog, you design and specify product changes and you further develop the product together with one or more scrum teams in an agile environment.

GE HealthCare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.

Job Description
Roles And Responsibilities:
• You and your peers in the highly experienced product design team such as UX experts, physicians and engineers own the entire product design of our product portfolio.
• Together with product managers, customers, internal and external stakeholders, and partners you elaborate requirements for product changes and new functionality
• Based on the requirements you design and specify functional and technical product changes with focus on realizing the minimal viable solution and providing business value continuously.
• In close cooperation with the scrum team and technical experts you verify the feasibility of design and integration concepts, and you create and prioritize stories and define acceptance criteria for the development team
• You hand over the functional design to development and monitor the progress of implementation and confirm user acceptance via concept and prototype reviews on a regular base
• You own and groom the backlog of an international and geographically distributed scrum team, prepare issues towards definition of ready and ensure definition of done at the end of development sprints
• You create the documentation of official product specification and detailed design requirements

Qualifications/Requirement:
• Degree in computer science, information technology, biomedical engineering, or a comparable qualification
• Working experience as product owner or requirement engineer and attitude to elaborate requirements, create design concepts, epics, user stories and use cases
• Knowledge of requirement management tools and development planning tools (e.g. JIRA, Polarion)
• Working experience as software/database developer or data analyst. Experience in professional agile software development and methodology (Scrum, SAFe)
• Experience in databases (such as Sybase, MySQL, ArangoDB) and data import, export, querying, aggregation, optimization, and visualization
• Clinical or medical domain experience such as medical workflows, analytics, examinations, or ultrasound is a strong plus
• Attitude to explore new technologies and applying them in a creative way to create new solutions
• Ability to work independent, pragmatically and solution oriented
• Team player, flexible and customer focused
• Excellent communication skills; fluent English, German is a strong plus

Inclusion and Diversity:

GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity.

Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.

#LI-ID1

#LI-HYBRID

Additional Information

Relocation Assistance Provided: No

data.job_description:
We believe that the right technology can make dentistry predictable, enjoyable, and less stressful!

Join our vibrant team at Straumann Group Berlin as a Product Owner (m/f/x) on a permanent basis to help develop our new, innovative software that makes digital design of dental restorations more intuitive.

Last year our products were used in the treatments of more than 15 Mio. patients in over 50 countries worldwide!

Your role
• You will join a team of POs (3 for now) splitted in Berlin & Lyon working on a feature/module level
• Working remotely with team members in Montreal
• Work closely with the Product Manager to determine the user/stakeholders needs for the products
• Maintain and prioritize the product backlog in a multi-cultural team
• Lead using appropriate project management tools and techniques for different projects in parallel
• Act as a motivator and ambassador of agile methodologies
• Ensure good communication between all functional teams for optimal product evolution
• Develop and maintain product definition and guidance documents
• Participate in executive presentations on product evolution
• Stakeholder care, milestone planning for customers/stakeholders
• Other related tasks

Your skill set
• Excellent English speaking and writing skills
• Professional training in science, engineering or a related field and experience as a Product Owner, university degree is a plus
• 2 years of experience as a product owner or the equivalent
• 2 years of experience in a regulated industry is a plus
• German language skills are a plus

How we work​

At Straumann Group Berlin, we value autonomy, openness, and delivering quality software on time. To do that we work closely together as a team, and it is important to us that every member can improve our product and processes. We find that an Agile approach with daily stand-ups, 3-week sprints, demos and retros work best for us to achieve our aims. We also collaborate with other colleagues working on DWOS in Montreal every other day.

What we offer​

To work on challenging projects in the oral health industry. We have short decision-making processes and a friendly, competent, diverse team of computer scientists, physicists and dental technicians. We go to lunch together daily. You have the flexibility to work as you like between our modern offices in Adlershof, Berlin and remotely from home. For us it is understood that in a pandemic the health and safety of you and your family comes first. Further benefits include:​
• Flextime model/trust-based working hours​
• 30 days holiday​
• Extra child sick days​
• Taking vacations on short notice​
• Public transport (BVG) subsidy
• Team social events (team breakfasts, summer & Xmas)​
• Lunch allowance, and free beverages, fruit and other snacks​
• No dress code​
• Shower facilities in the office​

Did we pique your interest?

Then we look forward to learn more about you, your motivation and your expectations.
job_required_skills: Certified Scrum Product Owner & Product Manager

data.job_description:
Abbott ist ein weltweit führendes Unternehmen im Gesundheitswesen, das bahnbrechende wissenschaftliche Erkenntnisse nutzt und Lösungen zur Verbesserung der Gesundheit der Menschen entwickelt. Wir blicken stets in die Zukunft und antizipieren Veränderungen in der medizinischen Wissenschaft und Technologie.

In Deutschland ist Abbott mit mehr als 3.000 Mitarbeiter:innen in den Bereichen Forschung und Entwicklung, Logistik, Produktion und Vertrieb vertreten. Neben dem deutschen Hauptsitz in Wiesbaden hat Abbott Standorte in Hannover, Neustadt am Rübenberge, Wetzlar, Eschborn, Jena, Köln und Hamburg.

 

Arbeiten bei Abbott

Bei Abbott finden Sie eine Aufgabe, die wirklich zählt, denn Sie verhelfen anderen Menschen zu einem gesünderen und erfüllten Leben. Wachsen Sie mit uns und lernen Sie stetig dazu – Sie können hier Ihre persönliche und berufliche Entwicklung vorantreiben und sich selbst verwirklichen.

Das erwartet Sie bei uns:
• Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten in einem internationalen Unternehmen, in dem Sie die Karriere machen können, von der Sie träumen
• Ein attraktives Benefits-Paket (z.B. attraktiver Abbott Pension Plan, Company Bike, Mitarbeiteraktienkaufprogramm)
• Eine herausfordernde Position in einer schnell wachsenden krisenunabhängigen Branche
• Die Möglichkeit, Teil eines dynamischen, hochqualifizierten und motivierten Teams zu werden
• Flache Hierarchien, offene, wertschätzende Mentalität und effiziente, konstruktive Kommunikationswege
• Ein multinationales Umfeld, in dem wir die Entwicklung unserer Talente innerhalb des Unternehmens fördern
• Ein Unternehmen, das als eine der “Best Big Companies To Work For“ anerkannt ist, sowie als bester Platz zum Arbeiten für Vielfalt, arbeitende Mütter, weibliche Führungskräfte und Wissenschaftler:innen

Für unseren Standort in Hamburg sind wir aktuell auf der Suche nach einem Software Product Owner (m/w/d)

Die Abbott Automation Solutions GmbH in Hamburg ist der internationale Innovationsführer für Laborautomation. Die modulare Automationslösung umfasst einen Einzelprobentransport, der die dynamische Anbindung von Analysegeräten sowie Probenvorbereitung und -archivierung in Laboren nahezu aller Größenordnungen erlaubt. Diese innovative Lösung zeichnet sich durch hohe Effizienz im Probendurchsatz, durch Flexibilität in der Gestaltung der Labore und damit durch Kostenvorteile für unsere internationalen Kunden aus. Weitere Informationen finden Sie auch auf unserer Homepage unter https://www.corelaboratory.abbott/int/en/offerings/brands/glp-systems.

IHRE AUFGABEN:
• Entwicklung und Kommunikation der Softwareproduktziele.
• Verantwortung für die Pflege des Softwareprodukt-Backlogs in enger Zusammenarbeit mit den Stakeholdern und dem Entwicklungsteam
• Erstellung und Verwaltung des Backlog basierend auf Anforderungen und Änderungen.
• Definiert Iterationen und Inkrements
• Priorisierung der Backlog Items in Abstimmung mit den Stakeholdern
• Iterative Verfeinerung und Klärung von Backlog Items zur Vorbereitung der eigentlichen Umsetzung
• Definition klarer Akzeptanzkriterien
• Release-Planung und Fortschrittsverfolgung
• Planung iterativer Releases
• Abnahme von Arbeitspaketen
• Verfolgung und Kommunikation des Fortschritts
• Unterstützung der prozessgerechten Dokumentation von Entwicklungsergebnissen
• Arbeit in überregionalen Teams

IHR PROFIL:
• Hochschul- / Fachhochschulabschluss im Bereich Medizintechnik, Elektrotechnik, Informatik oder ähnliche Qualifikation
• Mindestens 5 Jahre Berufserfahrung
• Fließende Deutsch- und sehr gute Englischkenntnisse
• Erfahrung in der Anwendung agiler/SCRUM Entwicklungsmethoden
• Erfahrung im Projektmanagement
• Idealerweise Erfahrung in der Entwicklung komplexer Automatisierungssysteme
• Erfahrung mit Jira (oder ähnlich) ist von Vorteil
• Möglichst Erfahrung mit normgerechter Entwicklung in der Medizintechnik
• selbstständig und im Team zu arbeiten
• Sicherer Umgang mit Microsoft Office

Business System Analyst & Technical Product Owner

data.job_title: Senior Product Owner - Food Internal Products (m/f/x)
data.job_description:
The role

As a Senior Product Owner in our Assortment Tribe within the Food Alliance, you’ll join a cross-functional team who is building technology solutions and tools powered by data and science focusing on assuring our internal physical product teams plan the products that best meet the end customers individual or family’s needs, despite our operational constraints. The Senior Product Owner works alongside UX design, engineering, data science, and business stakeholders to establish and execute our long-term product strategy.

What you’ll do
• Utilize customer and data-driven insights to define and refine key performance indicators (KPIs) and relevant metrics for assessing assortment success.
• Identify and prioritize opportunities and customer problems to develop a technology roadmap.
• Collaborate with a cross-functional team, including Engineers, Product Designers, Researchers, Product Analysts, and Data Scientists, as well as partner teams from local and global business units.
• Design and execute A/B tests to validate hypotheses and use experiment outcomes for informed decision-making.
• Break down complex projects into milestones, prioritize Epics and User Stories, and create Acceptance Criteria. Facilitate key Agile meetings and participate in organizational retrospectives for continuous improvement.

What you’ll bring
• Experience in building data products and internal/B2B products in an agile manner, preferably within the e-commerce industry at scale.
• Proficiency in using both qualitative and quantitative data to validate hypotheses and make data-driven decisions.
• Ability to lead product discovery, define problem spaces, and write product requirements for complex domains.
• Strong analytical skills with experience in analyzing large datasets, understanding statistical analysis, experiment design, and addressing common data analysis pitfalls.
• Excellent communication skills, including the ability to distill complex ideas into easily understandable concepts, attention to detail, and a willingness to share knowledge with others. Additionally, a demonstrated eagerness to learn new analytical methods, software applications, and tools.

What we offer
• Comprehensive relocation assistance to move to Berlin plus visa application support (if applicable)
• A significant discount on your weekly HelloFresh box
• Annual learning and development budget to attend conferences or purchase educational resources plus access to the HelloFresh Academy
• Mental health support, including Headspace subscription and access to qualified therapists through Spill
• Budget for home office supplies
• Monthly transportation budget through Rydes app
• Working parents support
• Additional perks include: Annual German language budget, discounts for John Reed gyms & Urban Sports Club, regular company events, fresh fruit & free drinks in the office, in-house yoga classes, weekly discount on the Convini vending machine in the office
• Hybrid working model (option to work from home for up to 50% if preferred)
• Sabbatical leave option after 18 months of being with HelloFresh
• HelloFresh Pension Scheme that is subsidized with 20% on top
• A diverse and vibrant international environment of 90+ different nationalities
• The chance to have a significant impact on one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Europe in an exciting growth phase

Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

For insight into our interview process take a look at our recent post here.

#PRODUCT #TECH

data.job_description:
Job Function

Business IT
Warum SoftwareOne?

SoftwareOne is powered by Swomies!

Every day, 9000+ SoftwareOne colleagues – we call ourselves "Swomies" – partner with clients to deliver inspired technical and licensing solutions to engage their workforce and accelerate cloud maturity. Our internal backbone of enablement functions needs to be strong to keep the company ready for delivering great services to our customers. Our internal IT team is one of these competent and passionate teams that enables all Swomies to stay technically uptodate and keep SoftwareOne`s operational excellence.

Solution Architect (70%) / Product Owner (30%) (gn) | Enterprise-Solutions

team: Business IT / internal IT of SoftwareOne | pensum: full time | location: EMEA / remote option

Das Aufgabengebiet

The main responsibility:
• 70% Architecture (50% Applications, 40% Process Design, 10% Infrastructure)
• 30% Product Owner

The key responsibility:
• You create suitable software designs, definition of interfaces and description of the dynamic behavior as well as the resource use of the software.
• You take over necessary Product Owner tasks and advise the Product Manager.
• You design and implement a loosely connected microservice architecture to synchronize, publish and deliver the data from our core business applications.
• You drive the development of our software systems in the direction of this vision / strategy.
• You continuously improve the architecture for a scalable and modular distributed software system, based on the domain driven design approach.
• You constantly observe and evaluate new software architectures, technologies, methods, tools and strategies to improve efficiency and reusability.

The surroundings:
• You are part of multiple self-organizing End2End delivery teams with an agile delivery approach focused on clear business outcomes.

The stakeholder:
• You will work closely with Product Manager and the development teams.

The People Lead:

Peter Lorenz is located in the near of Leipzig and will be the disciplinary leader for this role. Peter started his career as Systems Architect of Comparex (later merged to SoftwareOne) in 1997. Because of his constant work in the competence field of architecture within SoftwareOne you can expect a great competence that`ll let you grow in this field as well. You`re eager to get to know Peter a bit more before meeting him in person? Feel free to check his LinkedIn profile: https://www.linkedin.com/in/peter-lorenz-aa39a513b/

The team:

More than 400 Tech Experts in 11 countries build and operate the systems that run SoftwareOne. This team is called "BUSINESS IT" (BIT). They deliver 24/7 support through different time zones and work in a hybrid Multi-Cloud environment (AWS, Azure). Our global BIT team is leading the SoftwareOne's internal transformation by rethinking traditional IT and business operations, while driving innovation and productivity for its thousand's employees worldwide. #driventodeliver #thousandsstrong #allinone

Kenntnisse und Fähigkeiten

your experience & knowledge
• Experience with common design patterns of event-driven architecture and the principles of domain driven design
• Expertise in the evaluation and creation of distributed software architectures with current frameworks or libraries in the Microsoft ecosystem
• Excellent knowledge of UML, object-oriented programming, C #, Web API and best practices in microservice development in a Microsoft technology-oriented environment, including Azure FaaS / PaaS, are important
• Good understanding of meaningful unit tests, code reviews and CI / CD in order to achieve the required quality level
• User of "clean code" practices and test-driven development styles
• Well versed in domain modeling to develop elegant solutions for complex customer requirements

your language skill
• Very good English skills

your personality
• Proactive, self-motivated and courageous to develop challenging solutions
• Willingness and commitment to advise other developers
• Not hesitating to question the status quo
• Demonstrates the ability to work with a high level of autonomy

Das haben wir zu bieten

This is what makes us special as an employer:
• Global company culture: We defined our lived culture through 7 core values (https://www.softwareone.com/en/our-story/our-values)
• Come as you are: Wear what you feel comfortable in, not just while working from home!
• President’s Club: Exclusive recognition awarded by leadership and your peers.
• Flexible work: Do great work from anywhere, deliver excellence everywhere.
• Employee Exchange Program: Experience new colleagues and cultures around the world.
• Incentive programs: SWOmies award bonuses to colleagues who go above and beyond.
• Lifelong education: We pay for your new skills with tuition reimbursement.
• Employee stock option programs (SIX: SWON): Be an owner. All employees can be shareholders.
• Hire to Grow: We optimize our internal structures and feedback culture constantly to be your Employer of Choice, today and in future.

You need some more information?

Check this link tree and find all information you need to decide for us: https://swo.co/quick-links

You know someone who could be interested in working with us as well?

Share this job (or another) with your network and get the chance of our referral bonus for external referrers. https://www.softwareone.com/en/careers/external-referral-program

Interessiert?

Any questions? E-meet me!

Hi, my name is Nicole and I`m your partner in crime for this role. I`m building bridges for you to the best careers perspective at SoftwareOne. I`m happy to help you with insights and try to answer all your questions. Let`s connect on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/nicole-radtke/

#LI-NR

Job Title
Product Owner (m/f/d)

Job Description

In this role, you have the opportunity to make life better

You will drive the product and software platform definition for our next-generation patient monitors to ensure that we deliver the right and safe products to our customers.

You are responsible for
• Maximizing the value of our Patient Monitoring Devices by contributing to the product vision and roadmap
• Defining software requirements based on customer needs and post-market surveillance feedback
• Creating and prioritizing the backlog for global scrum team(s) in active collaboration with business owners, architects, marketing, and other stakeholders
• Facilitating iteration planning, defining program increment objectives
• Applying consistent Model-based Systems Engineering methodology with SysML.

You are a part of

a highly motivated Product Development and Cyber Security team driving the innovation and secure product definition for our next-generation patient monitors.

At Philips Medizin Systeme Böblingen GmbH we develop and produce patient monitoring systems for the global market. These are mainly used in emergency and intensive care medicine, pregnancy, and newborn monitoring, during operations, and in anesthesia.

Your team is part of a layered agile release train realizing the software platform for medical devices.

To succeed in this role, you’ll need a customer-first attitude and the following
• An engineering degree in computer sciences, biomedical engineering, or similar fields
• 3+ years of professional experience as a product owner, product manager, systems engineer, software architect, or similar
• Experience with the development or Model-based Systems Engineering of embedded device software in an agile environment, preferably in the healthcare sector
• Focus on quality, patient safety and reliability
• Strong communication skills and experience collaborating with internal and external stakeholders in a dynamic environment
• Fluent in English (must) and German (preferred).

In return, we offer you
• Purpose: Make the world healthier by doing meaningful work with a great team in an exciting and innovative environment
• Flextime and Hybrid working model: up to 2 days a week working from home
• Philips Pension Fund: Employer-funded pension plan
• Mobility and devices: Leasing bicycles, cars and also smart phones for private use
• Culture: Various team/cultural activities
• Philips University and Linkedin Learning: Wide range of professional training courses for personal development
• Philips MyShop: Discount on Philips products
• Philips in Balance: Various offers for physical and mental health courses

Why should you join Philips?

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on innovative, customer-first health technology solutions. Help us improve the health and well-being of billions of people, every year. Ultimately creating a career that no one could have planned for. Even you.

Philips is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to skin color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetic information, creed, citizenship, disability.

#LI-EU

data.job_title: Senior Product Owner (m/f/d) - Platform Group - SAP Signavio
data.job_description:
We help the world run better

Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!

Our Company:

SAP Signavio helps our customers understand, improve, and transform all their business processes – fast and in scale. SAP Signavio was created through the merger of Signavio, the leading cloud provider for process management, with SAP’s own process analytics product teams. Today, SAP Signavio is one of the fastest growing cloud units within SAP and represents SAP’s spearhead for all things process.

The Team:

The Platform Group is one of five groups in the engineering department at SAP Signavio, serving the application teams with integrated services. We value consistency, modularity & re-usability, and simplicity. We strive for a coherent user experience across the entire product suite and an effective & efficient cross-product development experience. To this effect, our teams provide and advance

1) the hub and framework of our product suite along with shared services, as well as

2) fundamental building blocks such as Cloud infrastructure.

Based in our Munich (or Berlin office) you will be working in a cross-functional team who values trust, respect and diversity.

We are looking for people who share our passion for creating products that people love to use. If you appreciate close collaboration, open communication, technical innovation, and rapid feedback, this is an ideal opportunity.

Join a passionate, growing, cross-functional team that is developing the collaboration hub within our Business Process Transformation Suite.

What you'll do:

What you'll bring:

The way we work:

Our teams work self-organized and agile. They are supported by dual leadership of a People Lead, with people development and leadership expertise, and a Functional Lead, with role-specific expertise. We focus on enabling people and creating the right environment for them to thrive.

#LI-Hybrid #SAPSignavioMunichCareers #SAPMunichCareers

We build breakthroughs together

SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.

We win with inclusion

SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.
